question_title: what is an infinite loop? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: A non terminating infinite loop is usually considered an error.

However there are some applications which are infinite loops on purpose. The are usually servers for event driven applications. Consider web servers. They loop infinitely until a request comes to them. They process the request and go back to their loop waiting for the next request.

Infinite loops can be nasty, so early computer theorist wondered if there was a way to detect them. In fact certain problems could be solved if we could tell if a program went into an infinite loop or not.

Alan Turing, one of the founders of computer science, provide the "halting problem." It answered the question, and he proved that one couldn't write a program which could determine if a general program contained an infinite loop or not.

The proof (by contradiction) goes along these lines.

Assume program, P, exists, and it reads another program, p, and tests it for infinite loops. It exhibits the following behavior:

P(p) prints "Halts" if p halts.

P(p) prints "Does not halt" if p does not halt.

Pretty straight forward assumption... ok?

Now, let's modify P to make a new program P', that does almost the same things as P, but just slightly different.

P'(p) goes into an infinite loop itself if p halts.

P'(p) halts if p goes into an infinite loop.

Basically, P' does the opposite of p.

Since P' works on any program, let's run the following:

P'(P') - basically have P' test itself. What does it do?

If P' halts, then P' doesn't halt.
If P' doesn't halt, then P' halts.

It can't do something and not do that thing at the same time. It's a contradiction, which unravels back to the assumption that P can exist.

Therefore P cannot exist.

question_title: How do format my system and not loose any data? [SEP] question_content: My system gets hung up frequently and I keep getting the blue screen sometimes.So I've decided to format my C: which is my main drive. I have a windows 98 SE currently installed. Don't have the install CD, but I have the whole windows 98 installation files in my D drive. I've got things like mp3, important documents & photos, MS Office, Visual Studio, Photoshop, etc on my main drive. Is there an easy way to format my system and re-install my current version of windows? [SEP] best_answer: No. There is no eay way. Perhaps the easiest is to simply buy another hard disk (if you can actually install one in your hardware) and install a fresh copy of the operating system on it, making it the a new c drive, but this raises some particular issues. Some applications (and many operating systems) require that certain files (configuration stuff, for instance) be on the same drive from which the system has booted (or on which the application is installed). So changing to a new drive like this will involve some obscure issues dependent on not so obvious details of how this or that program (including the operating system) was designed and implemented. 

==========
There are some things you'll have to think about here, before you do anything at all. I'll assume you aren't going to get a new hard disk, and discuss the problem as you laid it out. Namely, reformatting the existing C drive and reinstalling your system on it. 

Do you really need to reformat? You may be able to reinstall Windows over itself, and if a damage Windows file is part of the problem, escape without the major pain of reformatting. 

========
First, without the installation CD (or copies of all the files from it) you're sunk. I'm not sure from what you say whether you have a copy of the CD on your second drive or not. If you don't ... Trouble lies that way. 

Second, You must backup everything you have on the C drive that is not reinstalled from the distribution disks. And you must be certain that whatever backup method you choose will be able to actually read the backup formatted files after the reinstallation. It is not unusual, sadly, for some backup programs to be unable to actually read in the backup files it creates. 
"Backup" includes the operating system (Microsoft has dropped support for 98 and for SE, so you would be well advised to update -- my suggestion is to 2000, but some folks are willing to settel for 2000 Lite -- ie, XP. Or even to make this your opportunity to switch to a vendor who poses fewer problems -- the main option as I write this is one of the kind_of_Unixen), Linux -- my favorite is the SuSE distribution). And "backup" includes application files as well. Identifying just which files these are, and where they are is not always easy. Clearly all your pictures and documents you've written and would qualify, but applications (and operating systems) usually have several configuration files, history files, backup files, index files, ... which it will save time to have copes of. But, if an application doesn't provide for saving these and reinstalling them over a fresh installtion of the application, ...  There will be problems here as well. You might have to reconfigure some or all of your applications (and the operating system too) after reinstallation. this is a pain, but may be unavoidable...

Third, you must be certain that any new hardware you've installed will be recognized by the Windows boot routines at reinstallation time. It might be wise to start a reinstallation (with the intent of cancelling it essentially immediately) to test whether the BIOS will call up the Windows installation routines from wherever they are, and whether they will be able to find the new hardware. Since hardware support (ie, drivers and design troubleshooting) for 98SE has mostly been dropped, increasingly more hardware will not be supported for 98SE.  Without support, you'll have to write your own drivers -- not recommended.

Fourth, you must, when reinstalling, configure your software in ways which are compatible with how they used to be configured, lest there be odd (perhaps fatal) happenings from the incompatibilites. Some things don't matter -- like icon colors or the shape of the cursor, but some will.

Fifth, keep a record of what you did and why at each step of the way, starting before you begin backing up. Include all instructions (and options) and the immediate re

question_title: how personal storage area network works, how good they are, and is it worth the money? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Defining SAN:

Storage networks are distinguished from other forms of network storage by the low-level access method that they use. Data traffic on these networks is very similar to those used for internal disk drives, like ATA and SCSI.

In a storage network, a server issues a request for specific blocks, or data segments, from specific disk drives. This method is known as block storage. The device acts in a similar fashion to an internal drive, accessing the specified block, and sending the response across the network.

In more traditional file storage access methods, like SMB or NFS, a server issues a request for an abstract file as a component of a larger file system, managed by an intermediary computer. The intermediary then determines the physical location of the abstract resource, accesses it on one of its internal drives, and sends the complete file across the network.

Most storage networks use the SCSI protocol for communication between servers and devices, though they do not use its low-level physical interface.



Benefits:

Sharing storage usually simplifies storage administration and adds flexibility since cables and storage devices do not have to be physically moved to move storage from one server to another. Note, though, that with the exception of SAN file systems and clustered computing, SAN storage is still a one-to-one relationship. That is, each device (or Logical Unit Number (LUN)) on the SAN is "owned" by a single computer (or initiator). In contrast, Network Attached Storage (NAS) allows many computers to access the same set of files over a network. It is now possible to combine the SAN and NAS using a NAS head, such as the gateway manufactured by ONStor

SANs tend to increase storage capacity utilization, since multiple servers can share the same growth reserve.

Other benefits include the ability to allow servers to boot from the SAN itself. This allows for a quick and easy replacement of faulty servers since the SAN can be reconfigured so that a replacement server can use the LUN of the faulty server. This process can take as little as half an hour and is a relatively new idea being pioneered in newer data centres.

SANs also tend to enable more effective disaster recovery processes. A SAN attached storage array can replicate data belonging to many servers to a secondary storage array. This secondary array can be local or remote.


SAN types:

SANs are normally built on an infrastructure specially designed to handle storage communications. Thus, they tend to provide faster and more reliable access than higher level protocols such as NAS.

The most common SAN technology is Fibre Channel networking with the SCSI command set. A typical Fibre Channel SAN is made up of a number of Fibre Channel switches which are connected together to form a fabric or network.

An alternative, and more recent (2003), SAN protocol is iSCSI which uses the same SCSI command set over TCP/IP (and, typically, Ethernet). In this case, the switches would be Ethernet switches.

One alternative to iSCSI is the ATA-over-Ethernet or AoE protocol which embeds the ATA protocol inside of raw Ethernet frames. While a raw Ethernet protocol like AoE cannot be routed without something else performing the encapsulation, it does provide a simple discovery model with low overhead.

Connected to the SAN will be one or more servers(hosts) and one or more disk arrays, tape libraries, or other storage devices. In the case of a Fibre Channel SAN, the servers would use special Fibre Channel host bus adapters (HBAs) and optical fiber. iSCSI SANs would normally use Ethernet network interface cards, and often specialized TOE cards.

Storage area networks are of two kinds - centralized storage area networks and distributed storage area networks


Compatibility:

One of the early problems with Fibre Channel SANs was that the switches and other hardware from different manufacturers were not entirely compat

question_title: How do I get MS Excel '97 to display exponents properly, as in 7y "squared" (with a small superscripted 2)? [SEP] question_content: The help files say to use e+, e-, E+ or E- "in a section" (whatever that is) to display a signed exponent. [SEP] best_answer: You found the part of the help manual about formatted a number to see it in scientific notation (mantissa * 10^exponent) where Excel uses E instead of the "10 to the power" notation.

I don't have Excel 97 handy, but two approaches worked in a later version:
Make the text appear the way I wanted (with superscript exponents) in Word, then copy and paste it in.
Type the cell contents 7x2, then edit the cell, highlight just the "2" with the mouse, choose Format / Cell / Font and mark it "superscript."  Excel only changes the highlighted text.  

With both of the approaches, the cell contents are still "7x2" as a text string.  Excel does not see the superscripted 2 as an exponent.  As you probably know, in an Excel formula ^ is the exponentiation symbol.

question_title: how to share microsoft outlook  with others? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Although Outlook is not designed for multiple users, it is possible to set it up for more than one user.  First, configure it to download multiple email accounts.  Then, set up rules to direct mail addressed to individuals to seperate subfolders in the inbox.  When someone responds to their mail, it will default to be from the email that received the message.  When starting new messages, Outlook will default to the primary account; other users will need to click on "accounts" and choose that the message be sent from their account.  This isn't an ideal solution, but can work.  Outlook will not know where to distribute messages that have been sent via blind copy, and sent messages will all be in the same folder, although users can move sent messages into their own subfolders.\n\nAn alternative way to have two people share one computer is to have one user utilize Outlook for their mail, and the other user utilize Outlook Express, or Thunderbird by Mozilla.

question_title: when something is deleted on your computer,it's still on your hard drive .right? [SEP] question_content: If its still on your hard drive, when time passes and more memory is taken up on the computer, is the old (deleted) data over written on the hard drive and forever unaccesable, or is a program needed to get rid of it.\nAnd also, does defragmentation also rewrite the memory space and rid the info. [SEP] best_answer: When you first delete a file, it does still exist on your hard drive. However, the space that the file took up on the drive is now free to be reused by other files. This does mean that a new file can overwrite the old file, making it difficult to read or retrieve. However, even when a file has been written over, it is still possible to retrieve the underlying data. I have read that in some cases, experts with advanced tools can retrieve files that have been overwritten five or six times. There are programs out there that make sure data is really deleted by overwriting a file up to a hundred times with random data. This is probably overkill, but I'm sure it's effective. In most cases for normal people, such extreme measures should not be necessary.

question_title: what is drum printer and what is its merits and demerits? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: A drum printer is a printer which uses a rotating drum, some small 'hammers' and a large inked ribbon to print text on paper. The printer has a drum in which all the printable characters are etched on to it.  The characters are actually RAISED up NOT etched in to the drum. The drum will be postioned parallel to the paper and ribbon and spins at a very high speed. The hammers will be positioned behind the paper. In other words the paper is in between the drum/ribbon and the hammers. 

As the drum spins the respective hammer(s) will hit the paper pushing the paper against the ribbon and against the drum. This will then leave the imprint of the character on the paper. These printers usually have many of these hammers, some in the order of 24-48.  The drum has the characters etched on it in multiple rows usually skewed to the left by one character position.  See below:

 ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZABCDEFGHI...etc
 BCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZABCDEFGHI...etc
 CDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZABCDEFGHI...etc

This format allows for every character to be in every position at any ONE rotation of the drum. When the particular character at a particular point needs to be printed, the respective hammer 'fires' striking the paper against the ribbon then against the drum. In this operation you can have as few as 1 hammmer firing or as many as al l of them...it just depends on what needs to be printed.
Hope this helps.  I have left out many particulars but this should be enough to give you a basic idea.

question_title: wath is the rss????????????? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: RSS stands for "Really Simple Syndication." It’s a format that web sites and blogs can use to send updated headlines to you via services like My Yahoo!. My Yahoo! gathers the content you select from a variety of sources and displays it for you in one convenient location. Syndication means you don't have to visit each site individually to see what's new -- you simply scan headlines or brief article summaries and click to read the full text. That’s the "really simple" part. And it’s "really simple" for publishers to make their content accessible this way too.

To use RSS, you will need a special RSS news reader or aggregator that will allow you to collect and display RSS service. RSS news readers allow you to view the service you select all together in the same place and, by automatically retrieving updates, stay current with new content soon after it is published.

There are many different news readers available, many for free. Most news readers are applications that you download and install. Some others are web-based service you sign-up for that work inside your browser. Listed below are some popular options:
http://my.yahoo.com/s/rss-faq.html
http://www.feedburner.com 
http://reader.google.com 
http://www.newsisfree.com

Answers your ????

question_title: Looking for the easiest Martial art to learn. Any recommendations? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: If you're looking for a hard (striking) style, any of the variant forms of karate will fit the bill (kempo karate and shotokan karate are fairly popular).
If you're looking for a soft (throws, locks, etc) style, I agree with the aikido recommendation.  Especially if you just want to defend yourself and not strike people (Much easier to let the pavement, a convenient table, or bookcase strike them instead).  Aikido is very laid back and has a natural, non-aggressive feel to it.
If you want a little more aggression, try jiu-jutsu (the Gracie forms are great for winning tournaments) or judo.

And if you want to have fun and try something really different, try capoeira.

All these styles and more are available for view at wikipedia.org, and most of the major styles have websites (ie. www.aikiweb.com for aikido)

question_title: Why is Michael Jordan the best basketball player ever? [SEP] question_content: I don't agree that he is... but tell me WHY YOU think he is.  Is it the number of 'rings'? Is it his scoring? Was it the shoes? What was it that made you believe Michael Jordan was the best basketball player in the history of the NBA?  I don't hear a lot of substanitive argument, just statements that people seem unwilling to defend or debate.

So come on, give it your best shot!   

(After over 700 answers, this is my first question, and I'd really like to know why people believe what they do).  Thanks in advance for your responses! Have a good one!!! [SEP] best_answer: Well, let's see..... he can jump really high. Or maybe it's because he doesn't miss any shots. No, that can't be it. Perhaps, he's the best because he won slam dunk contests. Plus he pioneered the long baggy shorts. No, no, no....I think I got it:  ITS BECAUSE ESPN SAYS SO !!!!  Yeah, thats it.

Seriously, sorry to break it to you folks, but Michael Jordan is not the best player of all time. There is no legitimate argument, period. He might be one of the most exciting players to watch, but in terms of all around talent, Larry Bird and Magic Johnson are far and away much better. 

The reason some people say Jordan is the best is because there has been no athlete in the past two decades who has been more over-hyped, more promoted, and more marketed than Michael Jordan. He could not possibly live up to those standards. Between movies, shoes, cereal boxes, fast food and everything else he's advertised, who hasn't heard of Michael Jordan ? 

He came along at just the right time. David Stern became commissioner and heavily marketed the NBA to corporate America. What better face to put on it but Jordan. He played a flashier style of b-ball, be was polite and accesible to writers and fans. In other words, he was family friendly. But he played for the lowly Chicago Bulls.

So maybe if we increased the number of playoff teams from 12 to 16, the Bulls might make the playoffs and we can have Michael on t.v. more. And maybe if we added a slam dunk contest to the all-star game, people can see even more of Michael. Plus, we now have a 24 hour sports channel so nobody can possibly miss his high flying dunks and acrobatic moves.

Now, I 'm not trying to take anything away from Jordan. He was a great player FOR HIS TIME. He had great talent and was exciting to watch. But as far as dominating the league, that didn't happen until Bird and Magic had gone and the league expanded to 27 and 29 teams, thereby depleting the talent pool.

question_title: Why are the Detroit Pistons losing to the Miami Heat, Detroit is a far better team, but they are being beaten? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: I may not get the best answer for this, because you are obviously a Pistons fan and I am not, but there are several reasons, and if you are open minded, you will see that I am right.

1.  Detroit is the 2006 version LA Lakers of the 2004 NBA Finals. A favorite to win, yet so cocky that they believe that they cannot lose.  The media has only perpetuated this. i.e. Even after almost falling to the Cavs (the Cavs?!) most people had them as favorites against the Heat.  Had the media pegged the Pistons as even or underdogs, that may have motivated them some, but as Flip Saunders has said himself, Detroit feels like the "Fat Cats."  

2.  Miami only had their "core" together for 9 games (8 or 9, im not sure) this entire season.  Thats not much for a team that was assembled about 7 months ago.  They are just now finding out how to play as a team.

3.  No one thinks about the fact that Detroit and Miami have the same record in the second half of the season.  Thats right, Detroit DOES NOT have a better record than Miami in the second half of the season, and the Heat, have a far better playoff record than the Pistons.  As Shaq has said, "the regular season don't mean nothing."

4.  Miami is a deeper team than Detroit.  Look at Detroit, after McDyess and maybe Hunter, they have no one coming off the bench that is a threat.  Detroit was deeper last year, but foolishly made a trade with the Magic that only made them worse.  In effect, Detroit gambled that their starting five would not get injured or fatigued.

5.  As a Piston fan, you're tired of hearing this, I'm sure, as I am tired of saying it, but lets face the facts, Wade and O'neal would have gone to the Finals last year, had they not BOTH been injured.  

6.  The Pistons never admit that they need to adjust anything.  Example, whenever the Pistons lost games this year it was attributed to "boredom" with the NBA.  C'mon, boredom?  Their "If it aint rought it aint right" slogan is a cop out.  And whenever they lose (especially to the Heat) they give no credit to Miami, which has infuriated, and motivated them.  Admittedly, the Pistons ARE the best comeback team in the NBA, but do they LIKE going down 3-2 or 3-1, I dont think so.

7.  The emergence of a true superstar.  Dwyane Wade is becoming a super-superstar in front of their very eyes.  The best defense cannot stop him, no one can stop him.  Dwyane Wade is becoming the Flash.

Having said all that, I will also tell you what every other Heat fan won't.  I am scared shitless, that SOMEHOW Detroit will win the series.  I mean if they win the Next 2 games, game 7 is up for grabs, and Phoenix did it earlier this year, and San Antonio almost did it.  So although it is not likely, it is possible, that Detroit will win.  I know it and every Miami fan on the planet knows it.  But thats where we differ, Miami fans and players admit that they can be beaten, whereas, Detroit fans and Pistons will still think they can win, even after they've lost.  I hope this is Miami's year, and it SEEMS like it, but if anyone can beat them, it's Detroit.

GO HEAT!

question_title: Quelle différence existe-t-il entre le jogging et la course à pied ?? [SEP] question_content: j'aimerais le savoir car je dépenserai plus de calories en faisant de la course à pied.
J'aimerais avoir des détails précis, d'allure, de temps, etc [SEP] best_answer: Augustin f a raison. Cependant, il y a des différences de définitions selon qu'on utilise l'un ou l'autre mot. Du moins pour ceux qui pratiquent, c'est l'usage.
Faire du jogging signifie que l'on coure régulièrement mais sans but autre que la forme. Toujours la même allure sur un temps donné (30, 40 ou 60 minutes).
Faire de la course à pieds signifie plutôt qu'on s'entraîne d'une manière diversifiée. Plusieurs fois par semaine et à allures variées sur des distances et durées différentes à chaque fois. Tout ça pour améliorer ses performances et faires des compétitions.
Voilà, personnellement, la différence que je fais entre les deux.

Au fait, El Pechin, fartlek, c'est suédois.

Petit ajout à propos de ton autre question, Cordelia, un type qui fait de la course à pieds selon la définition sur laquelle nous somme d'accord, fais du jogging (ou un ptit footing :-)) POUR RÉCUPÉRER ! Donc c'est plus facile (s'il n'est pas débutant)  ;-)

question_title: Whatever happened to linebacker Andy Katzenmoyer? [SEP] question_content: Ohio State All-American, drafted 1st round by New England Patriots 1999. Played 1st 8 games of 2000 season, then nothing. What was Andy Katzenmoyer's NFL fate? [SEP] best_answer: Katzenmoyer suffered a neck injury during his first season with the Patriots that eventually forced him to have surgery and miss half of the 2000 season. During training camp in 2001, Katzenmoyer walked out without permission, citing concern about a feeling in his neck. He was placed on injured reserve for the remainder of the season. The Patriots cut Katzenmoyer before the beginning of the 2002 season, and he has not returned to professional football

question_title: Can females play on male sports teams in college? [SEP] question_content: Kathy was a student at State College. The student population was 45% male and 55% female. There were 9 male varsity sports teams and no female sports teams. Kathy wanted to play on a college team, but did not wish to leave State College to go elsewhere. Does she have any other recouse? [SEP] best_answer: If they let women play on men's teams, then they would have to let men play on women's teams, so the answer is, no.  It is not their fault which school that any player chooses to attend.  By law they should have women's varsity sports.  Have her check again to see which ones are available.  If they don't have the one she wants, she could petition to have it added.

question_title: Which MLB stadiums are considered hitters parks? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: espn.com has a link that provides park factors for each season from 2001 to 2005. This is an objective measure and can be broken down by runs, hits, 2b, 3b, HRs or bbs.

Park Factor compares the rate of stats at home vs. the rate of stats on the road.
A rate higher than 1.000 favors the hitter. Below 1.000 favors the pitcher.
PF = ((homeRS + homeRA)/(homeG)) / ((roadRS + roadRA)/(roadG))

For the 2005 season the top 5 hitter ballparks for runs were:

1. Coors field (Rockies)       1.285
2. Citizens Bank (Phillies)    1.161
3. Great American (Reds)       1.128
4. Turner Field(Braves)        1.095

question_title: i have a shimano deore mega 9 crankset. can i use an xt 8 speed rear mech or does it have to be a 9 speed? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: You probably need to repost and clarify a few things-  do you mean crankset (which is the front three gears) or cassette (which is the gearing on the rear wheel, usually 7 - 9 speeds)? Also, by rear mech, do you mean derailleur, or rear cassette?

I can tell you this - when Shimano moved from 8 to 9 speeds they changed the chain, so a 9 speed crankset and an 8 speed cassette might be problematic.

If you are only worried about your rear derailleur, then you should not have much of a problem - just set your adjustment screws correctly and go.

question_title: the lenth of cricket bat & weight of ball? [SEP] question_content: send details of these questions. [SEP] best_answer: The rules of the game limit the allowable size for a bat as not more than 38 in (965 mm) long and the blade may not be more than 4.25 in (108 mm) wide. Bats typically weigh from 2 lb 8 oz to 3 lb (1.1 to 1.4 kg) though there is no standard. The handle is usually covered with a rubber or cloth sleeve to enhance grip and the face of the bat may have a protective film.\nFor men's cricket, the ball must weigh between 5.5 and 5.75 ounces (155.9 and 163.0 g) and measure between 8 13/16 and 9 in (224 and 229 mm) in circumference. Balls used in women's and youth matches are slightly smaller.

question_title: names of emmitt smith's children? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Sometime in Emmit Smith's academic career, he received a paper with his name spelled "Emmitt" (notice the two T's). Emmit liked it, however, and decided to start spelling his name the same way. Thus was born the new Emmitt Smith. His father is Emmit Smith II and as a child, to avoid confusion, he was nicknamed "Scoey." He married Patricia Southall, on April 22, 2000. She is a former Miss Virginia, and the ex-wife of actor/comedian Martin Lawrence. Their son, Emmitt IV, was born on Smith's 33rd birthday, May 15. His entire family was on-hand and present on the sidelines that fateful October day in 2002 when he surpassed Walter Payton for the NFL rushing title.

On August 14, 2006, Emmitt James Smith, Sr., his grandfather died in Pensacola, he was 82.

In September 2005, Smith signed on to serve as a studio analyst on the NFL Network show, NFL Total Access.

On September 19, 2005, at halftime of the Cowboys-Redskins game (broadcast on Monday Night Football), Smith was inducted into the Dallas Cowboys Ring of Honor with his longtime teammates Troy Aikman and Michael Irvin.

Smith becomes eligible for induction into the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2010, and it is widely expected that he will be inducted on his first attempt. He was elected to the College Football Hall of Fame in 2006.

In 2006 he became one of the celebrities on the third season of Dancing with the Stars - Videos - [1]. It premiered on ABC September 12, which ended his time with NFL Network for the time being. He was partnered with Cheryl Burke, who danced to last year's championship with Drew Lachey. He drew mostly rave reviews from the judges and was a fan favourite as well. He did better at the Latin dances than the ballroom numbers, and suprised many people with how light he was on his feet. He chalked up his success on the show to his ability to accept coaching. On November 9th, 2006, he entered the finals of Dancing With The Stars along with Mario Lopez.

On September 30, 2006, he was one of the first four Gator legends inducted into the Florida Football Ring of Honor, alongside Steve Spurrier, Danny Wuerffel, and Jack Youngblood.

question_title: how is the baseball slugging percentage calulated? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Total bases Divided by number of at bats.

question_title: what is the best combination of sprockets to get more speed on go-cart? [SEP] question_content: its a briggs 5hp [SEP] best_answer: Smaller cog on the engine, larger on wheel or Axel.
That combination will give you more top end but a 
slower bottom end, meaning that it will take more
time to get to top speed. A larger cog on engine and
a smaller cog on wheel or axel will give you a higher 
bottom end but you won't get a faster top end.

question_title: Trying to ID a baseball? [SEP] question_content: I have baseball that's about 30 yrs. old. It has two intertwined baseballs on the logo, one ball has J ? BEER written in it, the other side is unreadable. Under the J BEER part it says ESTA and then unreadable. On the other panel it has NO. 62 and a lot of unreadable numbers. Any ideas on the manufacturer or league it was used in??? It has something written where the league would be, but it too is unreadable and faded. The ball was my grandfather's and it could be well over thirty years old.   HELP??? [SEP] best_answer: You have a baseball made by the J. DeBeers Co. (J stands for Jacob). DeBeers was bought by Worth Sporting Goods and recently Worth was purchased by Rawlings.

Jacob DeBeers started making baseball in 1889 in Albany NY.

Could easily be over 30 years, however, don't get your hopes up on how much it is worth.

question_title: What happened to Srilanka vs England match? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: 0.1 Hoggard to Vandort, 1 no ball, oversteps, bangs it in short, Vandort gets out of the way

0.3 Hoggard to Vandort, 1 leg bye, down the leg side, Vandort plays and misses, off the pad to short fine leg, Jones sprints across and fields the ball  
0.4 Hoggard to Tharanga, OUT, Hoggard strikes in the first over, short of a length delivery, Tharanga plays at it, gets the edge, straight into the hands of Jones, who takes the catch.

Sangakkara is the new man in
Two slips and a gully in place

0.6 Hoggard to Sangakkara, no run, good length delivery, Sangakkara mistimes the drive to extra-cover  
Flintoff to bowl 
End of over 1 (6 runs) - Sri Lanka 6/1 

KC Sangakkara    4* (2b 1x4)      MJ Hoggard    1-0-5-1 
MG Vandort    0* (4b)       

 
1.1 Flintoff to Vandort, no run, back of a length delivery, lets it go  
1.2 Flintoff to Vandort, 1 run, down the leg side, turns it square leg for a single.  
1.3 Flintoff to Sangakkara, no run, good length delivery, Sangakkara gets into line and defends down the track, fielded by Flintoff on his follow through.

question_title: favorite sport? [SEP] question_content: im in track right now but i don't want to do it anymore because its not fun to me anymore so im going to do sumthing else but the probelm is that i don't know what i should do! =(but i kinda suck at like all sports. i like volleyball but i kinda suck at that to...ive only done track for like 2 or 3 days. lol but i think i would like to do either soccer or soft ball or basket ball n i don't know... what should i do? [SEP] best_answer: I have played both softball and basketball!! I loved both sports. Since you've ran in track you would have what it takes to run up & down a basketball court... but are you good with your hand/eye coordination? Both sports really require good hand/eye coordination. I really don't know what to tell you. Just try them and see which one you like best or which one you are best at and go with that one. Sorry that I couldn't be of more help!!! Good luck, though.

question_title: What is the best thing to eat before a swim meet? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: hehe I think I come from the old school but whatever makes you feel good. I had a routine for meets. Steak 2 nights before, pasta night before, McDonald's in the morning 2 sets of hot cakes and 2 of those Cinnamon rolls(loved those things). And then for between prelims and finals I ALWAYS ate a large pizza from little Cesar's. I think eating those things just helped me have a standard to go by and not have to worry about what I was going to eat. (I would eat grapes during the meet)

question_title: What's More Entertaining? College or Pro Football? [SEP] question_content: With college you have rivalries that are much more bitter. You also seem to have a lot more team spirit. And the players are much more about their teams. 

In the pros you have a much more sophisticated level of coaching  and a much higher level of play. 

Just curious for your thoughts. I prefer the college game more. [SEP] best_answer: Frankly, I feel that the college game is superior when you have great matchups or long-time rivalries...The excitement is generally far better than anything the pro game can provide. 

The Pro game is hit or miss...Seeing one team crush another is rarely exciting and about the only time a game gets truly exciting is during the playoffs...

question_title: What shoes are good for rock climbing? [SEP] question_content: Rock climbing is just a casual hobby, so I don't want to fork out the money on professional climbing shoes.  Can I use sneakers or some other kind of shoe?  What actually makes a good climbing shoe?  I will be using mostly indoor walls. [SEP] best_answer: ive been an avid rock climber for almost ten years...get rock climbing shoes if you intend to climb regularly.  there is nothing more scary than placing your foot on a ledge no wider than a centimeter and feeling your feet slipping around inside your shoe.  talk about a major sphincter check.  plus climbing shoes are designed to place the toes in the most powerful position to allow for adequate stepping and their soles are made of sticky soft rubber so slippage is minimized.  going barefooted may seem logical, but stepping on sharp points of rock and placing all your weight on it can be excuriatingly painful.  plus, sweaty feet equals slippery feet.  there are large numbers of climbing shoes that are quite affordable as well.  look at brands like mad rock, evolv, mammut, or search websites like REI.com.  ive seen shoes as cheap as 50 to 60 dollars.....about the same cost as running shoes.....if youre going to climb regularly, this is the best advice i can give you, from one climber to another...good luck and aloha
